meanings.definition: A person who forfeits something as a penalty.
meanings.sent1: The forfeiters had to give up their prize for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent2: The forfeiters lost the game and had to surrender their trophies.
meanings.sent3: The forfeiters jokingly pretended to hand over their imaginary crown.
meanings.sent4: The forfeiters were like players in a game of chance, risking their possessions.
meanings.sent5: The image of the forfeiters reluctantly parting with their belongings stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: Those who give up or lose something as a punishment.
meanings.sent1: The forfeiters had to let go of their snacks for misbehaving in class.
meanings.sent2: The forfeiters regretted their actions when they had to surrender their toys.
meanings.sent3: The forfeiters playfully acted out their penalty by pretending to hand over their lunch.
meanings.sent4: The forfeiters were like sailors abandoning their ship in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look made the concept of forfeiters very real to the students.
